se.lypson.common
Class Utilities

java.lang.Object
  se.lypson.common.Utilities

public class Utilities
extends java.lang.Object

The Utilities class contains static methods that can be useful but does not require a class of their own.

Author:
Tobias Persson

Method Detail

encodeUrlString

public static java.lang.String encodeUrlString(java.lang.String stringToEncode)
Encode a string as (a part of) an URL, typically used for URL GET parameters. Entire URLs should not be encoded by this method! Non-alphabetical (A-Z, a-z) and non-numerical (0-9) characters are, with the exceptions of the characters in "-_.~" (without the quotation marks), replaced with a % followed by their two-digit hexadecimal string representation. Warning: Unicode characters with an ordinal number strictly larger than 255 are not accepted due to the limitation of a two-digit hexadecimal representation of characters that cannot be passed as they are.

Parameters:
stringToEncode - the string to encode as an URL part.
Returns:
The string encoded as a part of an URL, or null if the input string was null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if Unicode characters outside the range 0x00 to 0xFF is in the input string.
See Also:
Wikipedia: Percent-encoding

splitString

public static java.lang.String[] splitString(java.lang.String stringToSplit,
                                             java.lang.String splitString)
Splits a string into substrings.

Parameters:
stringToSplit - the string to split into several strings.
splitString - the string that splits stringToSplit. This string is not included in the resulting strings.
Returns:
An array with sub strings from stringToSplit splitted at the locations of splitString.

leftJustifyString

public static java.lang.String leftJustifyString(java.lang.Object object,
                                                 int minLength,
                                                 char filler)
Left justifies the string returned by an objects toString() method by inserting filler characters to the right until the resulting string is of a specified length. If the string returned by the object is longer than the requested minimum widht, no truncation is performed but no filler characters inserted either.

Parameters:
object - the object whose string representation will be right justified.
minLength - the (minimum) length of the returned string.
filler - the character to pad the string returned by the object with.
Returns:
The string returned by the object, padded with the filler character until the required width is reached.

rightJustifyString

public static java.lang.String rightJustifyString(java.lang.Object object,
                                                  int minLength,
                                                  char filler)
Right justifies the string returned by an objects toString() method by inserting filler characters to the right until the resulting string is of a specified length. If the string returned by the object is longer than the requested minimum widht, no truncation is performed but no filler characters inserted either.

Parameters:
object - the object whose string representation will be right justified.
minLength - the (minimum) length of the returned string.
filler - the character to pad the string returned by the object with.
Returns:
The string returned by the object, padded with the filler character until the required width is reached.

milliSecondsToDate

public static java.lang.String milliSecondsToDate(long dateTime)
Get a string representation of the date represented by the number of milliseconds since the beginning of the Java ME epoch.

Parameters:
dateTime - the number of milliseconds since the beginning of the Java ME epoch.
Returns:
The date in the format YYYY-MM-DD.

milliSecondsToTimeOfDay

public static java.lang.String milliSecondsToTimeOfDay(long dateTime)
Get a string representation of the time of day represented by the number of milliseconds since the beginning of the Java ME epoch.

Parameters:
dateTime - the number of milliseconds since the beginning of the Java ME epoch.
Returns:
The time of day in the format HH:MM, where HH is the hour between 0 and 23.

secondsToHMS

public static java.lang.String secondsToHMS(int seconds)
Get a string representation of the number of hours, minutes and seconds a specified number of seconds correspond to.

Parameters:
seconds - the number of seconds to calculate the number of hours, minutes and seconds from.
Returns:
The number of seconds as a string in the format HH:MM:SS, where HH is a non-negative number that may be larger than 23.

shallowCopy

public static java.util.Vector shallowCopy(java.util.Vector input)
Creates a shallow copy of a vector.

Parameters:
input - the vector to create a shallow copy of.
Returns:
A vector that is a shallow copy of input.

                                int i,
                                int j)
Swaps two elements in a vector.

Parameters:
vector - the vector where two elements should swap place.
i - the index of the first element that should be swapped.
j - the index of the second element that should be swapped.

                        IComparator comparator)
Performs a stable sort on the elements in a linked list, using a specified comparator to determine the order.

Parameters:
list - the list to sort.
comparator - the comparator used to determine the order of the elements in the list.

insertionSort

public static void insertionSort(java.util.Vector vector,
                                 IComparator comparator)
Sorts the elements in a vector using a specified comparator to determine the order of the elements. This method is suitable only for vectors with a small size. For generic use, see sort(java.util.Vector, se.lypson.common.IComparator)

Parameters:
vector - the vector to sort.
comparator - the comparator used to determine the order of the elements in the vector.
See Also:
sort(java.util.Vector, se.lypson.common.IComparator)

fillVector

public static void fillVector(java.util.Vector vector,
                              java.util.Enumeration enumeration)
Clears a vector, than adds all elements in an enumeration to the vector.

Parameters:
vector - the vector that will be filled with the enumerated elements.
enumeration - the enumeration of elements to insert into the vector.
